meanings.definition: The act or process of spoiling or becoming spoiled.
meanings.sent1: The spoilage of the milk left a foul smell in the kitchen.
meanings.sent2: The spoilage of the food in the fridge was a result of the power outage.
meanings.sent3: The picnic was ruined by the spoilage of the sandwiches.
meanings.sent4: The spoilage of trust in their relationship was irreversible.
meanings.sent5: The spoilage of the fruit attracted a swarm of flies.

meanings.sent1: The spoilage of the meat was evident from its unpleasant odor.
meanings.sent2: The spoilage of the surprise party was due to a leaked secret.
meanings.sent3: The spoilage of the movie ending was spoiled by the trailer.
meanings.sent4: The spoilage of the child's behavior was a result of indulgent parenting.
meanings.sent5: The spoilage of the vacation mood was caused by bad weather.

meanings.definition: The amount of goods that have spoiled.
meanings.sent1: The spoilage of the shipment led to significant losses for the company.
meanings.sent2: The spoilage of the vegetables in the store was due to improper storage.
meanings.sent3: The spoilage of the cake was a disappointment at the party.
meanings.sent4: The spoilage of the inventory was a setback for the small business.
meanings.sent5: The spoilage of the clothes in storage was a result of humidity.
